Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of faded added white dots, possibly from rosette, above two faded white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreparts of sphinx (part of hair with dab of added red, wing with red, body and top of foreleg) to left.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 289, no. 864, pl. 119)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1023) (phase 2)
